meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To apply the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) to the New Territories, to provide for certificates of exemption from certain provisions of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) for building works, site formation works and drainage works for certain buildings in the New Territories and to make necessary consequential amendments.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: balcony (露台) has the meaning assigned to it by regulation 2 of the Building (Planning) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. F); (Amended E.R. 2 of 2012)
canopy (簷篷) has the meaning assigned to it by regulation 2 of the Building (Planning) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. F); (Amended E.R. 2 of 2012)
certificate of exemption (豁免證明書) means a certificate of exemption issued under this Ordinance;
Director (署長) means the Director of Lands and any person authorized by him under section 11; (Amended L.N. 291 of 1993)
District (地方行政區) has the meaning assigned to it by the District Councils Ordinance (Cap. 547); (Replaced 8 of 1999 s. 89)
New Territories (新界) does not include New Kowloon;

def.name: PartyWall
def.leadIn: party wall (共用牆) means a load-bearing wall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forming part of a building used or constructed to be used for the purpose of separating adjoining buildings; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: from the floor level of the lowest floor of the building up to the underside of the roof, and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: from an external wall to the external wall opposite; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which has no door, doorway, arch, archway, window or other opening constructed in it;

subsection.def: roofed-over area (有蓋面積) means the area of a building enclosed within the external faces of the main structural walls (which includes any party wall) of that building together with, subject to subsection (5), the area of any balcony, stairway, verandah, porch, canopy or any other projection from the building.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance any word or phrase not defined in subsection (1) and which has a meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) shall have that meaning.

subsection.leadIn: Where a domestic building is divided into separate units by means of one or more party walls each such unit shall, for the purposes of this Ordinance, be considered to be a separate building if any such party wall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where that building is of a height of not more than 7.62 m, is a load-bearing brick wall of not less than 225 mm thick;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where that building is of a height of more than 7.62 m but not more than 8.23 m—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the height of the lowest storey, is a load-bearing brick wall not less than 340 mm thick; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for subsequent floors, is a load-bearing brick wall not less than 225 mm thick; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a load-bearing reinforced concrete wall not less than 175 mm thick.

subsection.leadIn: In determining the highest point of a roof no account shall be taken of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one stairhood if it has a roof area of not more than 7.44 m2, a height of not more than 2.14 m and is erected and used solely to provide protection from rain and sun for a stairway used to gain access to the roof of the building;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: one water storage tank if it has a roof area of not more than 2 m2, a height of not more than 1.22 m and is installed at any point on the roof other than on a stairhood.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating the roofed-over area of any building the area of not more than 2 balconies and one canopy shall be excluded if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: they all project from the same side of the building for a distance of not more than 1.22 m; and

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application of Buildings Ordinance to the New Territories
section.content: Subject to Part 3, the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) shall apply to the New Territories.

section.name: s4
section.heading: General power to issue certificates of exemption in respect of building works
section.content: The Director may issue a certificate of exemption in respect of any building works in the New Territories.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Special power to issue certificates of exemption in respect of building works
section.leadIn: Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Director shall issue a certificate of exemption in respect of building works in the New Territories—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a building to be built by any person and to be used for non-industrial purposes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a building to be built by a community organization for the use of the community;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a building to be built on agricultural land and to be used solely for agricultural purposes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for the replacement of a temporary structure in the New Territories.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Site formation works and drainage works
section.leadIn: Where the Director has issued a certificate of exemption under section 4 or 5 he may also issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate of exemption in respect of site formation works;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate of exemption in respect of drainage works.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2) and to compliance with any conditions imposed by the Director under section 9—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: sections 4, 9, 9AA, 14, 21, 30, 30A, 30B, 30C, 30D, 30E and 30F of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) and the regulations made under that Ordinance shall not apply— (Amended 20 of 2008 s. 47; 16 of 2011 s. 45)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in respect of building works or site formation works; and

paragraph.continued: specified in a certificate of exemption; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the provisions and regulations mentioned in paragraph (a) and section 28 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) shall not apply—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in respect of any drainage works; and

paragraph.continued: specified in a certificate of exemption,

subsection.continued: carried out by or on behalf of the person named in that certificate of exemption.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply in relation to a certificate of exemption issued under section 4 or 5 in respect of a building of greater dimensions than the building described—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a certificate of exemption in respect of new housing;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a certificate of exemption in respect of community use; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a certificate of exemption granted under section 4,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a certificate of exemption in respect of agricultural use, in Part 2 of the Schedule; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a certificate of exemption in respect of replacement housing, in Part 3 of the Schedule. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2012)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Certificates to be in writing
section.content: Any certificate of exemption issued under this Ordinance shall be in writing and in a form determined by the Director.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Director may impose conditions
section.content: The Director may issue a certificate of exemption subject to such conditions relating to safety and health or such other reasonable conditions as he may impose and any such conditions shall be recorded on the certificate of exemption.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Proof of issue of certificate
section.leadIn: For the purpose of any proceedings under this Ordinance a document purporting to be a copy of a certificate of exemption and purporting to be certified to be a true copy by the Director or any District Lands Officer shall be received in evidence on its production without further proof, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: until the contrary is proved, it shall be presumed that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the document is a true copy of the certificate of exemption; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person who certified the document was, as the case may be, the Director or a District Lands Officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such document shall be prima facie evidence of all matters contained therein.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Powers of Director may be exercised by District Lands Officer
section.content: The powers of the Director under this Ordinance, other than his powers under section 4, may be exercised on his behalf by any District Lands Officer of a District in the New Territories.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Transitional
section.content: Notwithstanding the repeal of the Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Ordinance (Cap. 322, 1964 Ed.) and the Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Regulations (Cap. 322, sub. leg., 1984 Ed.) by section 12, that Ordinance and those regulations shall continue to apply to any building works, site formation works or drainage works to which that Ordinance and those regulations applied immediately before their repeal, and which are in course of being carried out at the commencement of this Ordinance.

part.name: P1
part.heading: Certificate of Exemption in respect of New Housing or Community Use, or Issued under Section 4

subsection.leadIn: The building, when constructed, will be a building of not more than 3 storeys and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: of a height of more than 7.62 m but not more than 8.23 m and with a roofed-over area not exceeding 65.03 m2, and in respect of which the thickness of each load-bearing wall—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a load-bearing reinforced concrete wall is not less than 175 mm thick; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: of the lowest storey is in the case of a load-bearing brick wall not less than 340 mm; and

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: of a height of not more than 7.62 m—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with a roofed-over area not exceeding 92.90 m2 where the building complies with approved plans; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: with a roofed-over area not exceeding 65.03 m2.

subsection.content: In this Part approved plans (批准圖則) means plans prepared by the Director or plans so prepared and modified with his consent.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Certificate of Exemption in respect of Agricultural Use

section.name: s2
section.content: The building when constructed will be of a single storey and a height of not more than 4.57 m.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Certificate of Exemption in respect of Replacement Housing

section.name: s3
section.content: The building when constructed will have a roofed-over area of not more than 37.16 m2 and be of a height of not more than 5.18 m.
